title: ERA-Net Transport
segmentation: Yes, my name is Oliver from TV Rheinland we are coordinating your transport since 2004 and in our core business on national level we are managing the program mobility and transport technologies of the German Federal Ministry of.
Economics and technology.
I would like to start with a brief introduction into.
The concept of the European Research Area, which was introduced in 2001.
And the key objectives better use of scientific resources in Europe and an increase of Europe's competitiveness in general.
And one approach there is to reduce the fragmentation of research efforts and a better coordination of research activities at national and European level.
And one element therein is the owner scheme which was introduced in 2003.
So they are not.
Scheme was designed to provide targeted support for the coordination and mutual opening of National Research programs, and Secondly to establish long-term cooperation between national programs.
And therefore it is addressed through the national program owners, which are generally the ministries and program managers, which are generally agencies and research concerts.
So you're not.
Activities include typically the following activities.
The first of all, if some program representatives come together and try to find out if there are potential for cooperation, than they have to.
First of all exchange information.
The second step is the definition of preparation of joint activities.
So if you have once found a potential topic, you have to further development develop that you have to specify that you have to define a certain process and therefore Internet.
We most often apply a series of meetings.
And workshops where we also invite researchers and experts.

At the end of this process, if there will be an agreement, then implementation of joint activities take place which is most often done with a joint call, and if once the joint call has been launched and has been closed, the outcoming research projects will also be funded.
Incorporation by the participating.
Countries.
So what has been achieved from Bionic by the unit scheme?
So one can certainly say that there's been made progress in the reduction of the fragmentation across the European research area, and we have the European Commission so far.
Is funding or have has funded 71 units which are covering more, less or thematic areas that you can imagine.

So the financing works in that way that the European Commission Funds the from the framework program, the network of the national representatives, their coordination and all the activities that they need in order to prepare Joint Program Corporation.

Now I would like to come to you in a trance.
Which was actually the secondary net which started up.
In January 2004, currently we are preparing the transition in the second phase, which will run until 2010.

And then the transport is a network that comprises national ministries from 13 European countries that are in charge of transport research programs and they all together represent the national funding volume of approximately 300 million euro per year.
The focus of your transport is on publicly stimulated policy and technology research as well as on demonstration for all transport modes.
So one can say that insurance would serve to the program owners and managers.
And provides there for a supporting framework which helps them to facilitate transnational program cooperation.
But again, the owner transport does not provide funds for the resulting R&D projects.
This is to be given from the national programs.
To sum it up, even a transfer compliments the European Union International research.
In those cases where both national and the Community research do not provide satisfying results.
So here we have the map of Europe and the participating countries in a transport there.
So far 13 you can see that there are still many countries missing, particularly in the East and in the South of Europe.
We have established context to many countries from the Central and Eastern European area also to Turkey also to Portugal.
And we are preparing an enlargement of the group in the coming months.
You can also see the list of our partners.
It's certainly too small to recognize the names, but there are in total 16 partners.
13 of them are national ministries.
In three of them, research agencies or supporting organizations and the ministries.
The national ministries are Ministries of Transport of Research of Innovation.
It always depends on the different national.
Structure.

So you can see on the left hand side the Gray area which is representing the national transport research programs they comprise the major share of public money which is spent in Europe for transport research.
But in this first big pillar in Europe, the national programs predominantly aim at the funding of national projects according to their national Policy goals, according to their national interests.
The second big pillar in Europe.
The European Union's framework programmes.
The Framework Programme comprises comprising topics that are of interest of many, if not of all European countries and by definition they exclusively fund transnational Corporation projects.
But it turns out that there is also a need for the funding of transnational projects from the side of the national programs.
This also has to do with enlargement of the European Union.

Up to that point.

Today the first example is the Corporation Sir Ship, which is about survivability for ships here in seven European countries.
Participate in their cooperate and coordinate their activities on funding for R&D projects on the issue of how to rescue people in the case of collision, grounding and fire on board.
But besides this funding activity, they also make use of the R&D resides in order to support the policy, making me by giving more supporting the rulemaking at the International Maritime.
Organization.

Negotiation for funding.

So you can see that there is variable geometry.

In the in the composition of the groups, but even within the groups and the outcoming projects there's again a variable geometry of the countries that will fund, and this always depends on the interest of the of the national programs.

The Cooperation Group intermodal freight transport, which aims at the strengthening of the position of intermodal freight transportation and here in five countries.

Universities.

The coming periods 2008 to 2010.

To be the third option for public R&D funding of transport research in Europe.

And this also includes an increased or increased budgets for the Transmission Funding Corporation.
The partners agree to launch at a minimum of two new transnational program corporations per year and at least one joint Corp.

As I said that before, and the final point, and this is something really new.
We will for the first time try to set up a common funding Corporation between the national programs and the FP 7, and this instrument is called eronet.

And it works in that way that in the case that at least five countries come together, they bring together at least 5 million euro national funds.

For a joint program of duration of five years and then the European Commission can decide to put 1/3 of this national common pot on top.
